Data

This data product accompanies a research manuscript entitled “The Hierarchical Morphotope Classification: A Theory-Driven Framework for Large-Scale Analysis of Built Form”. It contains the classification of the entire building stock of 6 European countries, geographically split based on NUTS1 regions (2024).

Available data

Below is an overview of the available data. Applies to both Zenodo and CU repositories.

Coverage

The current coverage includes Austria, Czechia, Germany. Lithuania, Poland, and Slovakia. Other European countries are currently being processed.

Contents

  • {NUTS1}.parquet - Hierarchical Morphotope Classification results linked to building geometry
  • {NUTS1}_morphotopes.parquet - Hierarchical Morphotope Classification results linked to morphotope geometry
  • {NUTS1}_data.parquet - Underlying morphometric data linkable to building geometry
  • morphotope_data.parquet - Aggregate data linkable to individual morphotopes
  • label_name.json - Names of the cluster labels for first three levels of taxonomy
  • pen_portraits.json - Descriptions of the clusters for first three levels of taxonomy
  • ward_linkage.npy - The taxonomy itself encoded as scipy linkage object

File formats

Majority of the data is stored as Apache Parquet, with geospatial data being encoded as GeoParquet.

The data is split regionally based on NUTS1 regions.

  • {NUTS1}.parquet - GeoParquet 1.1.0. ZSTD compressed, with GeoArrow geometry encoding and covering bbox for fast spatial queries.
  • {NUTS1}_morphotopes.parquet - GeoParquet 1.1.0. ZSTD compressed, with GeoArrow geometry encoding and covering bbox for fast spatial queries.
  • {NUTS1}_data.parquet - Parquet, ZSTD compressed
  • morphotope_data.parquet - Parquet, Snappy compressed. All characters for non-outlier morphotopes - used to build the taxonomy.
  • label_name.json - JSON
  • pen_portraits.json - JSON
  • ward_linkage.npy - Numpy NPY

Data repositories

Zenodo

The main data repository is Zenodo, which contains a complete copy of the data product and issues a DOI to each version.

See the data product at doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.17076283.

Direct download

You can also download the data directly from the repository managed by Charles University.

NUTS1 HiMoC on buildings HiMoC on morphotopes Morphometric data
